newsitem.title: UK: Entergy says signs 1.05 bln stg loan.
newsitem.headline: Entergy says signs 1.05 bln stg loan.

text.p: LONDON, Dec 18 (LPC) - Entergy Corporation of the US said it has signed a 1.05 billion stg bank loan to help finance its agreed 1.267 billion stg bid for London Electricity.

Entergy Group will supplement the debt with a 240 million stg equity contribution to bid unit Entergy UK, which is taking the loans. ABN AMRO Bank, Bank of America and Union Bank of Switzerland are arranging the loans.
ABN AMRO Bank is also serving as agent.
The deal comprises two facilities with maturities of up to five years. Funds are available to buy London Electricity shares and for other liabilities brought about by the acquisition.
Under the terms of the deal, Entergy UK has agreed to arrange its capital structure so that the proportion of debt to debt plus equity is no more than 65 percent by the third anniversary of the loan.
